Description: Papyrus fragment bearing two lines of a Coptic text written along the fibres (recto) and three lines against the fibres (verso). Mounted with 10127, 10454.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Asyut (town), tomb (according to register; but see comment)
Curator's comments: Register says 'Found in some tombs in the hills behind Assiut' but the content refers to Bawit. Under study by Alain Delattre with a view to publication (updated March 2017).
Bibliographic references: Clackson 2000 / Coptic and Greek Texts relating to the Hermopolite Monastery of Apa Apollo (no. 28 (p. 91), no. 47 (pp. 118-119))
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (86582) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/86582)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Monastery of Apa Apollo
Acquisition name: Donated by: Rev Dr Gulian Lansing
